text: Nepal at the Olympics is a history which began in 1963. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Nepal is NEP. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== Nepal has been in fifteen Summer Olympic Games, and in four Winter Olympic Games. The country has never won an official Olympic medal. Bidhan Lama won a bronze medal at the 1988 Summer Olympics in Seoul, when taekwondo was an exhibition sport. The Nepal Olympic Committee was formed in 1962 and recognized in 1963. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == == Other websites == *om/olympics/countries/NEP/ Sports Reference *Home page Category:National sports teams of Nepal Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:Sport in Nepal
title: Nepal at the Olympics
